planet.name: WD 1856+534 b
Gaia DR2 2146576589564898688 b
planet.description: Whereas some white dwarfs show evidence for rocky material floating in their atmospheres, WD 1856+534 b is the first giant planet candidate transiting a white dwarf. During a star's red giant phase, any close-orbiting planets will be engulfed by the star, but more distant planets can survive this phase and remain in orbit around the white dwarf. The planet was discovered by Vanderburg et al. 2020 using the space based TESS Telescope.
planet.imagedescription: An artist's impression of the potential Jupiter-size planet WD 1856+534 b and its much smaller host star, a dim white dwarf. Image credit: NASA Goddard Space Flight Center.
